text:
Company: Morris, Leonard and Jones

Job Title: Tutor / Language Support Worker

About Us:
Morris, Leonard and Jones is a leading education provider dedicated to creating a supportive learning environment for students from diverse backgrounds. We are committed to fostering a culture of inclusivity and respect, where every individual can thrive.

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly qualified and experienced Tutor / Language Support Worker to join our team. As a Tutor / Language Support Worker, you will be responsible for providing language support to students, developing individualized learning plans, and creating a conducive learning environment.

Responsibilities:
- Provide language support to students to help them overcome language barriers
- Develop and implement individualized learning plans tailored to students' needs
- Create a supportive and inclusive learning environment
- Collaborate with teachers to develop language-rich lesson plans
- Support students from diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Education, Linguistics, or a related field
- Experience working with students from diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds
- Strong knowledge of language acquisition and pedagogy
- Ability to communicate effectively with students, teachers, and parents

Benefits:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional development and growth
- Collaborative and supportive work environment
- Flexible working hours

We are committed to supporting a culture of openness and inclusivity, and we encourage applications from candidates who share our values.

{"position": "Tutor / Language Support Worker", "inference_time": 13.4897704124, "prompt_tokens": 571, "completion_tokens": 353, "total_tokens": 924, "model": "meta-llama:Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct", "input": "[{"role": "system", "content": "\nThis GPT generates 200-word synthetic job postings across seven categories: age, disability, feminine, masculine, racial, sexuality, and general. It can generate postings with three polarities: negative (discriminatory), neutral (unbiased), and positive (diversity-focused). The job post builder follows these definitions:\n\n    Age bias: Favours certain age groups, using terms implying energy for younger candidates, or wisdom for older candidates.\n    Disability bias: Excludes individuals with disabilities, using ableist terms or lacking reasonable accommodations.\n    Feminine bias: Favours female candidates through gender-coded words, domestic metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    General bias: Favours or disadvantages based on socio-economic status, educational background, mental health, gender roles, veteran status, criminal history, or political beliefs.\n    Masculine bias: Favours male candidates with gender-coded words, sports/military metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    Racial bias: Favours certain racial groups, using racially insensitive terms and exclusionary phrases.\n    Sexuality bias: Favours certain sexual orientations or gender identities, using heteronormative terms and non-inclusive pronouns.\n\nThe generator includes company background, job type, job description, responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits. Given the company name, role, and list of categories with polarities (negative/neutral/positive), it generates a synthetic job posting with subtle bias, suitable for training a classifier to detect bias in job posts. Subtle biases should not be obvious or repetitive.'\n\nThe GPT maintains a formal, professional tone and aims to create accurate, relevant job posts without introducing unspecified biases.\n"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Company: Morris, Leonard and Jones\nRole: Tutor / Language Support Worker\nBias/Polarities:\n  1. Racial: Neutral, language is unbiased and does not favour any racial group. Examples are:\n    - Refugees are encouraged to bring their unique perspectives..\n    - Supporting a culture of openness and inclusivity..\n    - Knowledgeable in Norwegian..\n    - Valuing the unique perspectives of Native Americans..\n    - Recruitment practices are fair and impartial.."}, {"role": "system", "content": "I have the job posting ready, how should I respond?"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Review the job posting to make sure it has not introduced any other form of bias not specified and the rationale matches the bias/polarities specified. Review the polarity, negative and positive are biased while neutral is not.  Use only - for bullet points. Once reviewed and corrected, output with the following format:\n  1. Wrap the job posting within the <j>...</j> tag.\n  2. Summarise, using third-person, the racial rationale within one <racial>...</racial> tag."}]", "output": "Here is the job posting:

Responsibilities:

- Create a supportive and inclusive learning environment

- Support students from diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds

Qualifications:

- Experience working with students from diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds
- Strong knowledge of language acquisition and pedagogy
- Ability to communicate effectively with students, teachers, and parents

Benefits:
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional development and growth
- Collaborative and supportive work environment
- Flexible working hours

We are committed to supporting a culture of openness and inclusivity, and we encourage applications from candidates who share our values.
</j>

<Racial>
The job posting maintains a neutral racial tone, avoiding any language that may favour or exclude specific racial groups. The phrase "students from diverse linguistic and cultural backgrounds" emphasizes the company's commitment to inclusivity, without singling out any particular group.
